content.description:
This is a hard arete problem right of the

Butter Face

(the SW arete of the boulder).

A techy sit start follows the arete as it get progressively steeper and more difficult. The crux is up high where a very low percentage  dyno throw seems to be the only way to the top. Stout.
content.location: This is on the Butter Boulder. Head North, go uphill from parking lot looking for two large boulders, one with a yellow, west face.

content.description:
Butterfly is a slabby, more mellow alternative to the harder problems on the Butter Boulder.

It climbs the south face.
content.location: This is on the left of two large boulders seen North of the parking lot.

content.description:
This is a great problem I cleaned up and sent in Spring of 2007. It seemed new to me as I had to trundle a little choss to expose a key hold at the top. If you know of an earlier ascent, please chime in. Anyway....

Sit start in a large hueco in the center of the yellow face with underclings  and make reachy throws up and right. It has sustained and interesting movement.
content.protection: A pad and spotter (can be a dog).
content.location: At the parking lot, look due North and find the two largest boulders, the one on the left has a noticeable yellow face that faces West. There are several decent problems in this area.
